Reviews.Title: won't work for long
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: We bought two  of these TV's on black Friday from Walmart last year and wouldn't you know it that both tv's had the invertor power boards go out on them with in two days of each other. We are just days out of warranty and nothing we can do except pay to have another board installed at $ 190 dollars each.  Save your money and frustration and  buy a good TV. Spend the extra money and get a good TV. My kids were terribly disappointed as these were Christmas presents for thier rooms.Key points for trouble shooting the  board problems are:1 - no power when you turn on TV even after trying other outlets and doing the 30 minute unplug and reset process explained in the owner manual2- When you take the back off the unit to make sure the cord is good you will find a blown fuse in the lower right hand corner of the main power board. ( 4 amp 125 v fuse )3- replace the fuse, if it works again congrats you got off cheap !, most likely it will blow again because the transformers on the board are faulty. ( which caused the fuse to blow the first time)4- Now you have to order a new board at the cost of 60 dollars (cheapest i found on ebay) and replace yourself. Or take it to a shop who will do the same repair for about $190.5- its about a two hour job to do the repair yourself. Changing the board is very easy. Only 6 sconnections to make and they all are unique so you can't plug them in wrong. The only problem is there has not been an upgrade that i know of on the boards and you are uncertain as to how long the new board will last.

Reviews.Title: Good TV - Great Price - Buy the Warranty
Reviews.Author: K.P.
Reviews.Content: Just bought some of these from Walmart on Black Friday.  The model number is slightly different, but it has the same specs. This is a good to very good TV overall, but an excellent TV for the $148 price and remains a bargain even after paying $10-$15 for an extended warranty.1.) Based on the other reviews I read I bought the extended 2 year replacement warranty from Walmart for $15. You can buy this warranty for up to 30 days AFTER buying the TV, so it is still not too late if you bought the TV on Black Friday.  If you do not want the Walmart warranty then the manufacturer also has an optional warranty for $9.99 that extends the labor warranty from 90 days to a year. With this the labor will match the parts standard one year warranty. Consumer reports said most problems occur within the 1st year so either extended warranty would cover this period.2.) Like most HDTV's make sure to adjust the settings on the cable/satellite provider's box then adjust the TV settings.  I had a friend that bought the same models and complained about the picture not being as clear as standard definition and returned the tv instantly.  After questioning him in more detail it was his 1st HDTV and he did not adjust the settings.3.) I have Time Warner and adjusted the cable box box resolution to auto select.  Then I adjusted the picture to Personal and used the following customized settings:Backlight 20, Contrast 38, Brightness 40, Color 54, Tint G2, Sharpness 16.  For Advanced Settings I set the Color Alignment to Normal, left the Noise Reduction, Black Stretch, and Dynamic Contrast On, and the Gamma at Gamma 1With these settings the picture quality is Very Good.I am sure some other TV's on the market have better video quality and / or more features (Samsung Model UN32EH4050 Costco $239 today), but they cost at least 40% more than the Walmart $148 Black Friday price.  However if you bought one of the Emersons on Black Friday and you take the time to buy the extended warranty and properly adjust the settings, then I believe you'll find out this was one of the BEST DEALS out there!

Reviews.Title: died 14 months later
Reviews.Author: tmack
Reviews.Content: The tv worked great for a year good color and picture. Last weekend I hit the mute button and it turned off. It blew a fuse inside, bought another fuse and watched it as I plugged in the set it instantly blew. it is shorting to ground some where in the main board not worth fixing. So if you want a temporary tv for a low price this is the brand for you. In fact I have one for sale real cheap needs a little work.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: Pirates Fan
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these TVS on black Friday.  One has quit working already.  There is a problem with the power supply board on these TV's - DO NOT BUYMy TV's serial number starts with DS1 - maybe newer vintages are better????? would not risk itReplacement power supply is $75.  (plus labor if you don't want to do it yourself)

Reviews.Title: Buy Something Else
Reviews.Author: David T Stitt
Reviews.Content: My Emerson TV was "repaired" three times but did not work when I plugged it in. They finally decided they could not repair it. Guess what? The replacement one doesn't work!! If you want to spend hours on hold waiting to tell someone what is wrong, just to be entirely ignored, Then this TV is for you.

Reviews.Title: I work for the Company that makes these TVs, DON"T BUY IT
Reviews.Author: Brit K
Reviews.Content: I work in the customer support center for a company that manufactures these TVS. If I had a penny for each time I had a customer call in and say that their LC320em2 TV no longer powers on after 5 months of use, I would be filthy rich.Now the TV does come with a 1 year warranty, however you need to pay a disgusting repair fee of $110 to have the TV fixed. Its almost as if they purposefully make the TVs low quality, so you have to pay the warranty repair fee.I'm not tryna throw the company under the bus, but the truth needs to be said. I'm tired of having customers curse me out because their TV no longer powers on after 5 months and I request that they pay a $110 repair fee.Don't buy this piece of junk.....

Reviews.Title: Died within 5 months
Reviews.Author: MaryN
Reviews.Content: When it worked, it worked pretty good.  It died within 5 months, two months past warranty.  Buyer beware labor warranty only lasts 90.  If you have to pay for labor, you might as well buy new tv.  Do not ignore warnings this tv dies rather quickly.

Reviews.Title: Died within 90 days
Reviews.Author: lauraannxoxo
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV from Wal-mart for my husband as a birthday present. It worked fine for the first couple of months and then all of a sudden just went out while we were watching it. Fortunately, Wal-Mart accepts returns within 90 days so we were able to return for a full refund. The manufacturer's warranty is only for 90 days as well so I'm glad it failed when it did or we would have been out of luck. Had it failed even a couple weeks later, we would have not been able to get a refund.

Reviews.Title: Problems with driver transformers
Reviews.Author: skimask
Reviews.Content: These things are known to basically blow out transformers on the driver pcbs.$10 for a replacement part, take off the back cover, look for the transformer with a pinhole in it (small brown square looking thing, about 1" x 2"), 6 pins to desolder, 6 pins to resolder, done and done...

Reviews.Title: chemical smell
Reviews.Author: munch
Reviews.Content: We have had this tv since Christmas.every thing about this tv is great except for a chemical smell that comes out of the tv.I at first thought it was because it was new,but this smell is not going away after daily use.Since this tv is in our bedroom i have to wonder if this smell is safe to breath.Not sure if this is typical of this brand of tv or not.Just wanted to put my opinion of this tv out there anyway.Maybe others are experiencing the same problem.overall the quality of this tv is very good.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this piece of crap!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Kristina Miles
Reviews.Content: Purchased this t.v. From Walmart for my bedroom. I should have taken it right back because the picture was never great. But for the bedroom I figured it was fine. Last week I was watching t.v. As I was cleaning and it just shut off. It never went back on. So I looked up reviews and found out this was common with this particular make and model. So annoyed with it. I called Emerson and they told me sure we can fix it for $70 plus postage and parts.I was livid. I asked to speak to a manager (who knows if it actually was a manager) and explained my frustrations. They didn't care. I absolutely refuse to pay them anymore money for something that they know is wrong with this television already. He even admitted to me that they know this television is known for doing this but there is nothing they can do. I will never ever buy anything with the name Emerson on it again!

Reviews.Title: Bah don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: Sowens
Reviews.Content: Lasted about 7 months then blew a fuse. I replaced fuse and POP as soon as it is plugged in. After researching the model it seems there are many that have had this same problem. My choice now is to trash it or chance 60 to 80 bucks on a refurbished power supply board that is almost impossible to find because of all the others having this same problem. Don't waste your money on this one.

Reviews.Title: Great Tv
Reviews.Author: bc
Reviews.Content: great tv have had over three years no problemssometimes it rescan for channels on it ownbut i learned to just chill and let it do its thinghave bought emerson brand for years always good

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with this TV
Reviews.Author: txfrmboy
Reviews.Content: I bought this Emerson 32"HD TV around a year ago. It has always had a great high definition picture and given no trouble of any kind after many hours of use. I would reccomend this product to anyone seeking a less expense 32' HD TV!

Reviews.Title: Bad choice
Reviews.Author: PG
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for mother in law. She died a couple of weeks later. Four months I put it in my motorhome. We used it for two months. A couple of months later we used it for a week, then when I tried to turn it on it would not come on.  Since we are 100 miles from an "authorized" service location I took it to a local shop. They found the power supply is out, and everyone they called for a replacement told them it was obsolete part and they could not get it. I emailed Emerson/Funai and they told me they "have some for now." I called to order one and then was told they didn't have any, and that I voided the 1 yr parts warranty when I took it to the local shop. So off we go to buy a new TV ...guess which brand we WON'T be looking at?

Reviews.Title: HOW?
Reviews.Author: TroubleManClyde
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV from wal- Mart Last year and it worked great until the Channels started changing by themselves and now the picture is shaking And blury.

Reviews.Title: Worked for 90 days
Reviews.Author: Benji999
Reviews.Content: Turned it on a few days ago and was not working properly -- for example I could not change channels. It was fine up until then. Was able to get it working for a few minutes, then it would stop working. One time it shut off by itself. I don't have confidence in this TV to spend the $ fixing it, so will look for a different brand. Phoned Emerson. The rep was friendly but was not able to offer a solution except that I must have a bad wall outlet -- tested the sockets with other appliances and they worked fine.

Reviews.Title: Gave it one star only since 0 stars is not an option
Reviews.Author: Careful Buyer
Reviews.Content: Died after 14 months and only about 50 service hours...We bought this TV new for my wife's sewing room, but didn't set up the room right away when we moved in so it's been mostly unused.  We set up the room and the TV worked fine... but after a couple weeks... dead.  nothing.  Not their fault that we bought it early (wanted to make sure it'd fit when I set up the cabinets) and that it's now legitimately out of warranty, but interestingly, when we called Funai (it's actually a Funai with an Emerson sticker on it), their records are wrong and they show it out of warranty before we even purchased it.Picture and sound are good -- enjoy them for the (short) time they last.  And be sure to submit the warranty card if you do buy one... you'll probably need it.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working after 18 months of active use
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Johnson
Reviews.Content: We bought this tv as a Black Friday special and used it regularly for 18 months and maybe less then 2 hrs a week after that and it is currently 23 months from the purchase date and last night it just stopped working- there is no power what so ever.  After looking at the other reviews, seems like this is a common problem with them.  I have never heard of a tv working for such a sort period of time.It was also frustrating to use because of the lack of plug-ins for gaming units and a dvd player.  Our dvd player could hook in but we had to buy a special expensive cord and every time we want to switch from playing Wii to PS2 we have to change the cords.  It is a huge inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: I would give this a minus zero if I could
Reviews.Author: cinnee73
Reviews.Content: We bought this television in march of this year. Three months later it no longer works. I called customer service from the Emerson website and it appeared they would be replacing the television free of charge. I was to have a box sent with return labeling so it would be no costs to me. This was weeks ago(was supposed to be 7-10 business days). I have called them several times since to ask about the box. I was told the box was sent(although they did not have a tracking number for me) and should be here by Wednesday. If it was not here by then to call them back. Wednesday has come and gone and it is now Friday. Well the website I used for contact no longer has the numbers listed for contact, just a form to fill out and submit. Yes, folks I am getting the run around, the box was never really sent as I was told. I have also seen a consumer board with many complaints about these TV's and other Emerson TV's. The fact that they took down the numbers from the website speaks volumes to me.As most people, we do not have a lot of money and every penny spent on a product like this needs to last. We do not have the money to buy a new TV and now we are out the TV and hard earned money spent. I rarely ever comment on products but I have to on this one, as I would advise everyone, no matter the price of these TV's spend your hard earned money on another brand. Steer clear of these TV'S! If for some reason they grow a conscious and decide to do right by this consumer I will change my review.

Reviews.Title: What a joke
Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: The tv just died. It was manufactured in April 2012, but literally wont turn on today. There are over 400 bad reviews and similar scenarios out there. Wish I had read them prior to buying this piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: Has been a good tv.
Reviews.Author: Robert Tabor
Reviews.Content: I have had this tv for almost 2 years now and i have had no issues with it. I use this tv every day with my desktop and have gamed on it and watched many of movies and the quality is good. The item says that it only has 720p, however when connected to my desktop i have had it at 1080p and the picture quality looks good. If hooking up to a computer do it through hdmi. The quality is alot better! About 5,000 hrs of active use.

Reviews.Title: wish i could give it NO STARS
Reviews.Author: Imran Mohamed
Reviews.Content: This tv sucks - STAY AWAY FROM IT. Do a google search and you will finds loads of problems with the EMERSON brand. They make crappy tv's. I agree that they are cheap, but it is like throwing away money so it is not so cheap after all. Mine worked for 7 months and then the tv stopped working (Power supply issue) and since they only offer 90 days warrenty on labor there is nothing I can do. All retailers should throw this tv back to the vendor as this will also give them a bad rep for nnot being able to stand behind their products.

Reviews.Title: GOOD FOR JUST A YEAR
Reviews.Author: rosa
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a TV that is good just for a year,this is the TV for you.After a year there is not picture, just sound.The customer service prety much said "To bad, take to a shop to fix it".was just after 12 month what could I say: Junk , junk,junk.

Reviews.Title: Never buy this TV!!!
Reviews.Author: André Martins
Reviews.Content: I am with the same problem of everybody... I just used this TV few times, less than 15 hours, I am sure, and the TV suddenly turned off and never worked again... I bought the TV 4 months ago and the 90 days warranty just finished some weeks ago. Now I need to pay US$ 70,00 just to sent it to the repair service, almost 1/3 of the amount I payed for this trash... I tried to change the fuse, but the new fuses blowed at the same time I plugged the TV at the energy. So my sincerely advice: Never spent your money with this brand, you are not saving anything!!!

Reviews.Title: GREAT VALUE!
Reviews.Author: ministarman
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV at Walmart to replace a 26" RCA LCD that had gone "belly up!"  I wanted the least expensive 32" I could find for my bedroom, and at $249.00 I was not particular about brand.  I also bought the $20.00 2 year warranty extension.  Once home and connected, I was pleasantly surprised by the picture quality and the range of controls for both video and audio.  My only complaint is the lack of RCA outputs for audio.  There is a digital audio output, but I have an older external audio system that does not accept a digital signal input.  Otherwise, it is a Great Value!

Reviews.Title: Terrible, did not last 3 months
Reviews.Author: Yazen Awad
Reviews.Content: I bought the tv at the end of September and it barely lasted 3 months.  Luckily it was still in the 90 day return policy at Walmart.  I was on my PS3 when sparks started flying out the back.  The HDMI port on the back of the tv blew, along with my PS3.  Invest your money on a different tv, I contacted Funai (the maker of the tv) and they told me since I was using an HDMI cable, they really wouldn't cover the repairs anyway because I connected an external component to it.

Reviews.Title: Warranty Stinks
Reviews.Author: L.Adamson
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to have in a spare room that my granddaughter uses when she visits.  It was probably used only 4 or 5 days when it wouldn't come back on at all.  Took it back to Walmart....they only cover the product for 10 days!  Said I'd have to go through the company but they didn't have a number.  I finally found a number after several transfers. Emerson then told me it would be $70.00 to send it back to them for repair.  That's too much money (along with the original purchase price) to put into a piece of junk!  The quality was ok when it worked but I expect a TV to last longer than this and to be replaced for free if it doesn't last any longer than that.  I will never purchase electronics at Walmart again and I'm through with Emerson!!

Reviews.Title: Still alive
Reviews.Author: Caohu09
Reviews.Content: I'll update my review if need be, but I purchased this TV black friday of 2011.It working fine for me! I haven't had any issues!I do use the remote to turn the TV on versus the button however. (Read the reviews online.)

Reviews.Title: save your money
Reviews.Author: Justin Humpa
Reviews.Content: I got it because it was a bit cheaper that the one I wanted at first...should have gotten the other one...this tv didnt last me 2 day and the screen went out on me. Emerson tvs are junk. My parents have a 19" Emerson and the screen flickers and sometimes the HDMI prots dont work.

Reviews.Title: Great for us!
Reviews.Author: John A. Mosley "gamebug"
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV at a Black Friday event in 2012. They didn't have any more in the store so this was a 'ship-to-store after purchase" situation. I have no idea what people are talking about this TV being a dud. We are still using this TV. It still works and has the same crisp quality since day 1. It is also used daily. No problems. It has even withstood the occasional slap to the screen by our son, who is almost 2 w/ a pretty good swing for someone his age. He does not beat the TV daily but at least once a week, when a commercial or show he likes come on. Smack! Still great. No damage. Great TV for only $161 (w/ warranty).

Reviews.Title: Read the Reviews!! Do not buy
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: Same one mine lasted a year and then the power board died. Rarely used the tv not worth buying and catchy warranty my extended that I bought with the tv wouldn't cover because manufactory warrenty was only 90days

Reviews.Title: Do not buy.
Reviews.Author: Maureen Rogers
Reviews.Content: I wish I had read the reviews before buying.  This seldom-used TV went out after a year and a half.  Sounds like the same problem most other people have had. Power supply. Would cost $140 to repair.  I will retrieve set from repair shop and try the fuse change.  (I was told over the phone that these TV's no longer have a fuse.)

Reviews.Title: Waste of time and money in my personal opinion.
Reviews.Author: Megan
Reviews.Content: So I received this TV as a gift in 2011 for christmas.  I didn't use it until I got to college in August 2012.  When I took it out of the package it was broken (it wouldn't work at all).  So I took it back to walmart and exchanged it for the same type of TV.  When I got it home it worked just fine.  I have used it since then until earlier this week in November-just a little over a year after I bought it-and it was plugged in and I was watching TV when it just turned off.  No storm or anything.  When I tried to turn it back on it wouldn't turn on.  I tried everything suggested to me to try and get it to work and well I am still with out a TV.  So I wouldn't recommend this TV because I didn't even have it a year and a half didn't harm it in anyway and overall I feel like it was a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: blows fuses
Reviews.Author: connie
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Emerson tv model number LE220EM3 June 2012 and logged maybe 15 hours of view time on it. I purchased it for my son and daughter-in-laws' use when they visit. As I stated maybe 15 hours of use in 12 months. I turned it on as I was cleaning the bedroom and no lights or sound. Called Emerson and was told the warranty was out so they would not help at all. Took it apart and found a blown fuse. Bought exact replacement fuses from Radio Shack and the new one blew immediately. This tv is truly junk! Buy another brand!

Reviews.Title: Power outage problem!!
Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: Same thing as most other reviews...got at Black Friday almost 2 years ago and went to turn on tonight...NOTHING!!  Tried other outlets, still nothing!  CRAP to only work 2 years...spend your money on another better model, cuz in the long run, you're gonna have to buy another one 2 yrs. later anyway!!

Reviews.Title: Waste of Money!!!
Reviews.Author: Unhappy
Reviews.Content: We had our T.V for 15 months and it had less than 20 hours watch time and it just shut off. This is the biggest piece of crap I ever bought! don't waste your money and the customer service is worthless !

Reviews.Title: MADE A 80 YEAR OLD MAN HAPPY
Reviews.Author: RON GARRISON
Reviews.Content: I BOUGHT THIS AS A BIRTHDAY GIFT FOR MY GIRLFRIENDS FATHER, HE ABSOLUTLEY LOVES THIS TV. HE TOLD ME IT WAS THE BEST TV HE EVER HAD, AND THIS IS WHAT IS IMPORTANT TO  MAKE HIM HAPPY

Reviews.Title: Crappiest TV ever
Reviews.Author: Matt J. Duffy
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV at Wal-Mart. It only worked for 9 months before crapping out. What a waste of money. Will never buy an Emerson again.

Reviews.Title: Horrible TV even worse customer service
Reviews.Author: JC
Reviews.Content: We have had this tv for just over the 90 day mark.  It is a tv in a guest bedroom so has maybe been used maybe 5 times.  Now there is no power.  After reading all the info below and deciding that I have the same issue, I called Emerson.  The only thing good about the experience that I can say is that at least it did not take too long to get to a person.  Let's just say English was not his first language. He did not try to do any trouble shooting since he knew immediately that it was a manufacturing problem and that the board needs to be replaced.  And. . .because it is just over the 90 day warranty, they will send me a box to send it to them for the wonderfully low price of 70.00.  I wanted to tell him what to do with his tv but then decided $70.00 is still better than going out and buying another tv.  Supposely if they cannot repair it, they will replace with a new tv.  I guess we will see when all is said and done.  But I can say right now that I will never, ever buy another Emerson product.

Reviews.Title: I love my tv.
Reviews.Author: Eve E.
Reviews.Content: The tv came early i love the picture and sound. it's a lot of fun to have. I didn't have any trouble figuring it out either.

Reviews.Title: Not packed
Reviews.Author: rickey moxey
Reviews.Content: my emerson tv came with the screen crack no back for the remote control not properly packed in a box with a couple pieces of news paper and unmarked am not pleased.

Reviews.Title: JUNK! CRAP! WORTHLESS!
Reviews.Author: Megatron
Reviews.Content: DO NOT PURCHASE ANY EMERSON TV! The warranty is garbage, the cost of the power supply repair is not feasable considering the cost of the TV.  These TV's obviously blow up on a regular basis.  Wish I knew this when I bought this TV for my son.  Now hes stuck on summer vaction with no TV to play games on.  Horrible customer service. Walmart is absolutely no assistance with this issue. They know there is a problem with the design and are doing nothing about it.  Wish there was a class action lawsuit I could hop on.

Reviews.Title: Horrible TV
Reviews.Author: Najmul Arfeen
Reviews.Content: After having problems with the digital connection for several weeks in the beginning, the tv has given out completely and hasnt turned on in about a week. We looked into the warranty information and can see that as soon as the 1 year parts warranty goes out, the tv dies too.

Reviews.Title: Quit Working Less than Two Years Later
Reviews.Author: B H "bargain hunter"
Reviews.Content: I rarely use this TV, and it's quit working less than two years after purchasing it.  Of course, the warranty is just a year.  Bad purchase.

Reviews.Title: What a deal
Reviews.Author: Louzu
Reviews.Content: I cannot tell that it is not full HD works and looks fine. The Unit fit in the cabinet and it is a good 2nd or 3rd tv in the house.

Reviews.Title: nothing to write home about, but seems to work ok
Reviews.Author: David DeWall
Reviews.Content: We bought one of these on black Friday like the other reviewer. We haven't had any problems yet with it. We mostly watch it in the bedroom for a couple hours a night. It's only been in use for a few months, but for the cheap price I'm happy with it so far.

Reviews.Title: Pinging
Reviews.Author: Pinger
Reviews.Content: I bought my emerson on black friday from walmart. It worked fine for 9 months. Now there is a pinging noise coming from the tv..check this though..i unplug the tv,now there is no power going in and it is still pinging,WTF.

Reviews.Title: EMERSON GOTO HELL!
Reviews.Author: jigsaw
Reviews.Content: TV DIDNT LAST A YEAR....IT JUST DECIDED TO HOLD ITS BREATH AND THREW UP THE DUCES AND SAID IM OUT! S.O.B.!!!!!!I GOT EXACTLY WTF I PAID FOR ! PIECE OF SHUT MY MOUTH! JUST DARKNESS!!! LOOK AT THAT MF...WONT SAY OR DO ANYTHING!  I WAS WATCHING HGTV AND THE MF JUST WENT BLACK! I DIDNT GET TO SEE THE COMPLETE RENOVATION OF THE HOUSE THEY WAS WORKING ON!MIDDLE FINGAH TO EMERSON 32"

Reviews.Title: No value at all
Reviews.Author: Ron K
Reviews.Content: Bought TV on Black Friday, last year. This TV is rarely used. Within 15 mos it has just died on us.i cannot believe such garbage is passed on to the public. I was looking for a value product and ended up with nothing. Walmart company should be ashamed at the product they represent. There are plenty of people upset about this product, Do Not Buy !

Reviews.Title: Good for One Year
Reviews.Author: Calamity Jane
Reviews.Content: My Emerson is a 39-inch LC model with 1080 pixels. The picture is quite decent for the amount of money paid. The sound is great. It's actually better than the defective Vizio I returned to the store (see my other review for Vizio). Set up was easy. I didn't even need to refer to the instruction manual. The remote is perfect. Everything is displayed where I thought it should be. There is no bright neon logo light on the front of the screen,like Vizio has. The entire frame is black and non-intrusive.The picture quality isn't as crisp I would like it, but it's certainly doable for people on a tight budget. If you sit directly in line with the screen, the blacks will be jet black, but if you sit slightly off to either side, the blacks become dark grey. It ruins the contrast. If you're single and you can hog the TV for yourself, it'll be great for you.I don't like the flat-screen touch controls (on/off, volume, channel selector, etc) built into the TV frame. They are impossible to see without bending down and getting within inches of the panel.****UPDATE**** April 2013. The touch screen controls on the TV frame stopped working. None of them respond to touch. The TV won't even turn on and off unless I use the remote. I'm thankful the remote works, otherwise I'd be out of luck because the warranty expired a couple days ago.

Reviews.Title: Unreliable pwr supply inverter board
Reviews.Author: protojim
Reviews.Content: I will buy your broken one that stopped working, or I can fix it for you, or sell you the service manual :)Pretty inexpensive tv and a bad design for pwr supply / inverter board that goes bad.email protojim@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: Poor Warranty
Reviews.Author: Larry
Reviews.Content: Within one year from the date of purchase of a Emerson 39" TV, the power board went out.  I contacted Emerson customer service and was told to email the parts department and I would hear from them within 48 hours.  Three days later I called again and was told I probably hear from them shortly.  Six days past and I called again. This time I was told the warranty was voided because the TV had been opened and I should have mailed it back to Emerson.  The first two representatives never mentioned sending the TV back.  So much for customer service.  I will never buy another Emerson product.

Reviews.Title: worst tv and customer service ever had to deal with
Reviews.Author: kaitlin
Reviews.Content: It was great until the left side started fading in color after the first 2 months of us having it, i wasn't concerned about it because I'm not picky about picture. Well after 6 months of getting it I was setting my daughter down for a nap, and I hear a pop. When I looked up at the TV it had a 4 inch in diameter  crack in it with horizontal and vertical lines across the screen, when i touched the crack I realized it was an INTERIOR crack from faulty hardware and cheap material. I called customer service up and explained to them what happened, the agents f****ng insinuated and assumed I was lying to get a new tv, this including the SUPERVISOR whom was courteous enough to argue the whole time i was stating my situation. I told them I will send that P.O.S. back to them and they can look at it them selves, when they see the interior crack that their insipid company is supporting. I had a 3 hour conversation  with the customer service just to be told I am lying and to send them $70 to fix the P.O.S. for labor. Being told by the company's appointed supervisor they only cover the first 3 months. Outraged i am posting this review as many times as it takes for every one not to buy their crap product. Buyer be warned you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Content: This is a junk you would spend money on! It cost me only $150.00 to buy an open box yet my money was wasted! I read more than 200 bad reviews on this product and the Maker "Emerson" itself, this is the first ever junk I bought from emerson and it will be the last one! the maxmum age of this TV is 3-8 months, emerson gives only 90 days waranty so every seller is....after 90 days they will tell you to drive to their repare shop which could be from 2 hours to 4 hours driving away, average labor cost $120.00-$380.00 sounds funny? the TV itself costs under $250.00, what about your gas and mileage? be smart with your money, when these stupids move their production plants to china, provide us with 3rd world standard product, and still want to charge us 300% more than what it actually costs to make, you need to stick with local and more expensive products for so many reasons!
